      • setCoordinates

        public MapboxDirections.Builder setCoordinates(java.util.ArrayList<Position> coordinates)
        Set the list of coordinates for the directions service. If you've previously set an origin with setOrigin() or a destination with setDestination(), those will be overridden.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - List of Position giving origin and destination(s) coordinates.
        Returns:
        Builder
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setOrigin

        public MapboxDirections.Builder setOrigin(Position origin)
        Inserts the specified position at the beginning of the coordinates list. If you've set other coordinates previously with setCoordinates() those elements are kept and their index will be moved up by one (the coordinates are moved to the right).
        Parameters:
        origin - Position of route origin.
        Returns:
        Builder
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setDestination

        public MapboxDirections.Builder setDestination(Position destination)
        Appends the specified destination to the end of the coordinates list. If you've set other coordinates previously with setCoordinates() those elements are kept and the destination is added at the end of the list.
        Parameters:
        destination - Position of route destination.
        Returns:
        Builder
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getProfile

        public java.lang.String getProfile()
        Returns:

        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getCoordinates

        public java.lang.String getCoordinates()
        The coordinates parameter denotes between which points routing happens. The coordinates must be in the format:

        {longitude},{latitude};{longitude},{latitude}[;{longitude},{latitude} ...]

        - Each coordinate is a pair of a longitude float and latitude float, which are separated by a , - Coordinates are separated by a ; from each other - A query must at minimum have 2 coordinates and may at maximum have 25 coordinates

        Returns:
        String containing coordinates formatted.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getAccessToken

        public java.lang.String getAccessToken()

        Returns:
        your Mapbox access token.
        Since:

      • getGeometries

        public java.lang.String getGeometries()
        Returns:
        DirectionsCriteria.GEOMETRY_GEOJSON, DirectionsCriteria.GEOMETRY_POLYLINE, or DirectionsCriteria.GEOMETRY_FALSE
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getOverview

        public java.lang.String getOverview()
        Returns:
        The overview, full, simplied, etc.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getRadiuses

        public java.lang.String getRadiuses()
        Radiuses indicate how far from a coordinate a routeable way is searched. They are indicated like this:

        ?radiuses={radius};{radius}}[;{radius} ...].

        If no routeble way can be found within the serach radius, a NoRoute error will be returned. - Radiuses are separated by a , - Each radius must be of a value float >= 0 in meters or unlimited (default) - There must be as many radiuses as there are coordinates - It is possible to not specify radiuses via ;;, which result in the same behaviour as setting unlimited

        Returns:
        String containing formatted radiuses.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isSteps

        public java.lang.Boolean isSteps()
        Returns:
        true if you requested step information in setSteps(Boolean).
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isContinueStraight

        public java.lang.Boolean isContinueStraight()
        Determine whether the route's been set to continue straight or not.
        Returns:
        true if continuing straight, otherwise false.
        Since:
